content: The "National Clinical Care Commission Act" establishes a Commission within the Department of Health and Human Services to evaluate and make recommendations for improving coordination of programs related to complex metabolic or autoimmune diseases caused by insulin issues in the United States. The Commission will consist of voting members from various Federal agencies. The National Clinical Care Commission Act establishes a Commission within the Department of Health and Human Services with voting members from Federal agencies and departments, including Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, National Institutes of Health, and others. Additional voting members can be appointed under paragraph (2). The Commission established by the National Clinical Care Commission Act includes additional voting members appointed by the Secretary with expertise in various specialties related to the prevention, care, and epidemiology of diseases and complications. These members come from physician specialties, primary care physicians, non-physician health care professionals, patient advocates, national experts, and health care providers serving specific patient populations. The Commission established by the National Clinical Care Commission Act consists of members appointed by the Secretary with expertise in specialties related to disease prevention and care. The Commission evaluates and makes recommendations to the Secretary of Health and Human Services and Congress on federal programs focusing on preventing and reducing disease incidence. The Commission meets at least twice a year and fills vacancies in the same manner as original appointments. The Commission will submit an operating plan to the Secretary of Health and Human Services and Congress within 90 days of its first meeting, outlining specific activities, completion plans, and involvement of members and other individuals. Additionally, within 3 years, a final report with findings and recommendations must be submitted to the Secretary of Health and Human Services and Congress. The Commission will terminate 60 days after submitting the final report or by the end of fiscal year 2021.
